Description:
[u][b]About this mod[/b][/u]

So, here we are again. It's their second game and they still don't provide hotkeys for these commands. This is a port of my two Pathfinder: Kingmaker mods, [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderkingmaker/mods/75]Weapon Set Hotkeys[/url] and [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderkingmaker/mods/72]Toggle AI and Strealth Hotkey[/url]. Additionally Quick Slots, i.e. for potions, scrolls etc. and the function to scroll through selectable characters can be hotkeyed as well as formations and action bar panels (scrolls, abilities, quick slot items).

[b][u]Important[/u]
There is no key validation. Make sure other installed mods don't use the same key![/b]

[u][b]Installation[/b][/u] (tested with game v2.7.0x, UMM v0.32.4.0)

[list]
[*]Install the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/21/]Unity Mod Manager[/url]﻿
[*]Either add the mod using the mod manager or extract the contents of the archive to the 'Game\Mods' folder (e.g. Steam\steamapps\common\Pathfinder Second Adventure\Mods)
[u]For version 3.*:[/u][*]When updating to v3.* make sure the old mod folder '[i]HotKeySetAiStealth[/i]' is deleted
[*]Install Mod Menu (v2.0.10 or later) ([url=https://github.com/CasDragon/ModMenu/releases/latest]GitHub[/url]﻿)
[*]Ingame, open the options menu, navigate to the 'Mods' tab and open the 'Additional Hotkeys' panel
[*]Assign buttons
[/list][u] ﻿
﻿For version 2.*:[/u][list]
[*]Ingame press Ctrl + F10 to open the mod manager dialog﻿
[*]In the [i][b]Additional Hotkeys[/b][/i] section, enable the the options you want to use, assign a key, toggle additional options, etc.
[*][i][b]Enable verbose logging[/b][/i] is only relevant if you have problems with the mod and should be disabled during normal gameplay
[/list]
[b][u]Description[/u][/b]

[list]
[*][u]Weapon Sets:[/u]
Assign a key for each weapon set and/or a key to scroll through them. This can be applied to all selected characters and to the inventory, character sheet and spellbook via the mod options menu.[/list]
[list]
[*][u]AI and Stealth:[/u]
Hotkey function is applied to all selected characters. Only works 'on the field'.[/list]
[list]
[*][u]Quick Slots:[/u]
You can assign a key to each of the five slots. Items displayed in the Quick Slot bar are always left aligned regardless of their position on the inventory panel. With the option [i]Use quick slot placement[/i] you can choose between Quick Slot bar and inventory placement.[/list]
[list]
[*][u]Character Selection:[/u]
You can assign two keys to select the next and/or previous character according to the character panel. (pets included)﻿[/list]
[list]
[*][u]Formations:[/u]
You can assign a key to each formation or scroll through them.[/list]
[list]
[*][u]Action bar panels:[/u]
You can assign a key to toggle each sub panel (scrolls, abilities, quick slot items).[/list]
[u][b]Available localisations
﻿
﻿[/b][/u]English, German, Simplified Chinese (is set according to game language, defaults to english)

[u][b]Known Issues[/b][/u]

[list]
[*][u]Quick Slots:[/u]
Selected items a character [b]CANNOT[/b] use, i.e. spells, etc., are activatable via hotkey but the items ability is not executed and the item is not consumed[/list]
[list]
[*][u]Breaking Change when updating to version 3.*:[/u]
From version 3.* onwards this mod requires [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/mods/370/]Mod Menu[/url] ([url=https://github.com/CasDragon/ModMenu/releases/latest]GitHub[/url]﻿ for v2.0.10 or later). All hotkey bindings will be handled via the Mod Menu interface. That also means all bindings need to be redone.[/list]
[list]
[*][u]Breaking Change when updating from version 1.* to version 2.*:[/u]
Settings are saved differently so all bindings need to be redone. If there's a problem binding a key or updating the settings delete the settings.xml file found in the mods folder in your Pathfinder install folder.[/list]
[u][b]Uninstallation[/b][/u]
Either uninstall the mod using the mod manager or simply delete the [b][i]ApoccHotkeys (v 2.*: HotKeySetAiStealth)[/i][/b] folder in the games 'Mods' folder.

[u][b]Thanks[/b][/u]

[list]
[*]to [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/users/2760975]newman55[/url]﻿ for the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/21/]Unity Mod Manager[/url]
[*]to ﻿[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/users/153578353]WittleWolfie[/url] for the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/mods/370/]Mod Menu[/url]﻿﻿﻿
[*]to [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderkingmaker/users/60155436]Spacehamster2[/url]﻿ for the helpful suggestions (which are still valid after almost three years...)
[*]to [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/users/114484113]Xenofell[/url] for inspiration how to group my﻿ ui settings
[*]to [url=https://github.com/magian1127]Magian[/url] for the localisation﻿ to Simplified Chinese
[*]to Owlcat Games for Pathfinder: Wrath of The Righteous
[/list]
Source code available on [url=https://github.com/apocc/pw-mods]GitHub[/url]

Description:
[b]Allow Modded Achievements[/b]

By default, modded games may not get achievements and their saved games are flagged as being modded. This mod disables the mod tracking functionality so you can gain achievements again.

There are many quality of life mods that do not impact balance which should not block achievements. Please do not use this mod to cheat.

[b]How to install[/b]

0. Download the latest published zip file.
1. Install[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/21] UnityModManager[/url]
2. Install the zip with UnityModManager.

Source code: [url=https://github.com/cstamford/WOTR_AllowModdedAchievements]https://github.com/cstamford/WOTR_AllowModdedAchievements[/url]

* Crusading Magic
* Deathless Spirit
* Exalted Resistance
* Heavenborn

* Maw or Claw

Description:
﻿# About

Mount all your animal companions automatically with a customizable keybind.

# Install
1. Download latest release from [here](https://github.com/zephe0n/AutoMount/releases/latest).
1. Download ModMenu for prettier mod menu [here](https://github.com/WittleWolfie/ModMenu/releases/latest)
1. Download and install [Unity Mod Manager](https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/21).
    1. You can also use ModFinder (recommended). Downlaod it from [here](https://github.com/Pathfinder-WOTR-Modding-Community/ModFinder/releases/latest)
1. Drag mod zip and ModMenu zip into Unity Mod Manager (or ModFinder).
1. Run your game.
1. Profit.

# Features
- Allows mount/dismount with a customizable keybind. 
    - Mount: **Ctrl+Shift+A** (default).
    - Dismount: **Ctrl+Shift+D** (default).
- Auto mount when entering area (toggleable).
- Whitelist party members mounting by party slot position.

# FAQ

Ask and I shall answer.

# Planned upgrades
- Use party member names instead of party slot number.

# Notes
- You can make the mount/dismount toggleable by assigning the same keybind to both funcions.
- Even though you can tecnically mount/dismount anywhere anytime (as long as the game allows it) it **will** consume your move action if you perform it while in combat.
- On mounting riders will teleport to their respective mounts. I don't intend to implement any movement animation for the time being.

Description:
# Automatic Bonus Progression An item rebalance mod for Pathfinder: Wrath of the Righteous based on Pathfinder's [Automatic Bonus Progression](https://www.d20pfsrd.com/gamemastering/other-rules/unchained-rules/automatic-bonus-progression/) ruleset. **This is not compatible with controllers.** ![Progression screenshot](https://github.com/WittleWolfie/AutomaticBonusProgression/blob/main/screenshots/progression.png) ### This mod creates a save dependency. Once you save with this mod enabled it must remain enabled or you will lose access to the save. ### [Settings are NOT in UMM, they use Mod Menu](#mod-options) ## Problems or Suggestions File a [bug](https://github.com/WittleWolfie/AutomaticBonusProgression/issues/new?template=bug_report.md&title=%5BBUG%5D) or [feature request](https://github.com/WittleWolfie/AutomaticBonusProgression/issues/new?template=feature_request.md&title=%5BFeature%5D). You can also reach me (@WittleWolfie) on [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/owlcat) in the #mod-user-general channel. ## Installation Download [AutomaticBonusProgression.zip](https://github.com/WittleWolfie/AutomaticBonusProgression/releases/latest) and install it using ModFinder or Unity Mod Manager. Make sure to install [TabletopTweaks-Core](https://github.com/Vek17/TabletopTweaks-Core) and [ModMenu](https://github.com/WittleWolfie/ModMenu) as well. ### If you use this on an existing save, you'll need to respec both regular and mythic paths to get full functionality. ### This doesn't work with controllers. You have to use mouse and keyboard. ## How it works Automatic Bonus Progression automatically grants stat bonuses usually provided by items which no longer provide them. As a result you are free to equip items based on their special abilities and effects. *Note: Items in game still list these bonuses in the UI, but they do not apply. I will likely never address this, as it is a huge effort to fix.* * **Armor Attunement**: *+X Enhancement to Armor* * +1 Chainmail * **Shield Attunement**: *+X Enhancement to Shield* * Armor attunement is lower when a shield is equipped * **Weapon Attunement**: *+X Enhancement to Weapon* * +1 Greataxe, Amulet of Mighty Fists +1 * **Off-Hand Attunement**: *+X Enhancement to Off-Hand Weapon/Secondary Natural Attacks* * Weapon attunement is lower when dual wielding or using secondary natural attacks * **Resistance**: *+X Resistance to Saving Throws* * Cloak of Resistance +1 * **Deflection**: *+X Deflection to AC* * Ring of Deflection +1 * **Toughness**: *+X Enhancement to Natural Armor* * e.g. Amulet of Natural Armor +1 * **Mental Prowess**: *+X Enhancement to Mental Ability Score* * Headband of Wisdom +2 * **Physical Prowess**: *+X Enhancement to Physical Ability Score* * Belt of Strength +2 | Level | Bonus | | :----: | ------------- | | 3 | +1 Resistance | | 4 | +1 Armor
+1 Weapon | | 5 | +1 Deflection | | 6 | +2 Mental Prowess | | 7 | +2 Physical Prowess | | 8 | +2 Resistance

+5 Tougness
+6/+4/+2 or +4/+4/+4 Mental Prowess
+6/+4/+2 or +4/+4/+4 Physical Prowess | | 19 | 3 Legendary Gifts | | 20 | 5 Legendary Gifts | Mental Prowess and Physical Prowess allow you to select which ability scores to boost. The bonuses you receive are further customizable using Legendary Gifts, detailed below. ![Legendary gifts screenshot](https://github.com/WittleWolfie/AutomaticBonusProgression/blob/main/screenshots/legendary_gifts.png) Each Legendary Gift allows you to select a different special bonus. In addition to the Legendary Gifts you receive at level 19 and 20, you receive 2 Legendary Gifts at every Mythic Level for a total of 28. If you are on the Legend path, you receive an additional Legendary Gift at level 22 and every two levels after. ### Legendary Ability Gain a +1 inherent bonus to any ability score. You can select this legendary gift multiple times, and it stacks up to +5 in any one ability score. ### Legendary Prowess This allows you to increase the bonuses granted by Physical Prowess or Mental Prowess. You cannot increase the bonus to any single ability score above +6. ### Legendary Shieldmaster Removes the armor enhancement bonus penalty applied when using a shield. ### Legendary Twin Weapons Removes the weapon enhancement bonus penalty applied when using off-hand or secondary weapons. ### Legendary Enchantments ![Attunement screenshot](https://github.com/WittleWolfie/AutomaticBonusProgression/blob/main/screenshots/attunement.png) Allows you to apply enchantments to your equipment (Armor, Shield, Weapon, Off-Hand). Each enchantment has an Enhancement Cost and you can apply enchantments with a total cost equal to your rank in the corresponding feature (max 5). #### Armor Enchantments * Name: Better Backgrounds
Author: BurlyWurly
About: Revises and improves many of the default Background choices while also introducing several brand new Background options.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Initial Release

Description:
The introduction of Backgrounds was a very welcome change from Kingmaker to Wrath of the Righteous. Unfortunately, with the exception of a couple very specific builds they are largely meaningless. This mod seeks to rectify that issue and ensure that Backgrounds which provide meaningful effects to a wide variety of characters are available. This is accomplished through three means:

1. [b]Weapon proficiencies provide trait bonuses instead of enhancement. [/b]By default, characters already proficient in a weapon who select a Background that provides that proficiency receive a +1 Enhancement bonus when utilizing this weapon. This makes no sense, as one's background should not provide the same form of bonus as a magical item. This also stacks with Masterwork weapons because of how the bonuses are coded. Eligible characters now receive a +1 trait bonus when using the correct weapon which should provide a minor but meaningful use for the whole game.
2. [b]Revamping of pre-existing backgrounds.[/b] Many of the backgrounds have had the skills and proficiencies they provide adjusted - some considerably.
3. [b]Introduction of new backgrounds.[/b] Three brand new backgrounds (Knight, Skyseeker, and Templar) were created to fill what I felt were clear gaps in the current background array. I hope to add more as needs can be identified and new backgrounds developed to fulfill them.

[i]DISCLAIMER: This mod is not made for installation with the Unity Mod Manager. [/i]Read the installation instructions very carefully. I am not a C# coder, therefore this mod was made utilizing Owlcat's Wrath Modification Template for Unity. Eventually this will be installable through the Steam workshop but until then there's no way around manual installation that I'm aware of.

Modfinder Installation (Preferred Method): Download and install [i]Modfinder [/i]by WittleWolfie at:
https://github.com/Pathfinder-WOTR-Modding-Community/ModFinder
Download GreatRadiance, then drag and drop the zip folder onto the "Drag zips here to install" block at the bottom of the Modfinder interface.

Manual Installation Instructions:
1. Navigate to [i]user-folder[/i]/AppData/LocalLow/Owlcat Games/Pathfinder Wrath Of The Righteous/ and create a new folder named 'Modifications'.
2. Unzip the mod and place the 'BetterBackgrounds' folder and all its contents in there.
3. Create a file named 'OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json' and place it within [i]user-folder[/i]/AppData/LocalLow/Owlcat Games/Pathfinder Wrath Of The Righteous/    
*4. Open 'OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json' in notepad and add the modification to it by inputting:
{
     "EnabledModifications": ["BetterBackgrounds"]    
}
5. Enjoy! 

*If you're running another Unity Mod such as my GreatRadiance mod simultaneously, the syntax looks like this
{
      "EnabledModifications": ["BetterBackgrounds", "GreatRadiance"]
}

If there's a particular background you'd really like to see added, or you think one of the currently implemented backgrounds needs work, please leave your ideas and feedback in the Posts section.

If you enjoy this mod, my other mods are available at the links below:
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/mods/143]GreatRadiance[/url] - Makes Radiance a greatsword (or virtually any other weapon)
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/mods/134?tab=description]Chrom (Matt Mercer) Voice Pack[/url] - Adds the voice of Chrom from Fire Emblem as a selectable voice

## Changes
```
* Added "Dead Is Dead" setting. When a party member dies, your save is copied to a backup file called "BBB_Backup.bak" and then deleted.
* Added ModMenu support.
* Added new cheats such as teleporting you to the port, island, or boat; finishing the island you are on; showing the map anywhere you are; etc.

In addition, every time they are hit with an attack they heal equal to their level in this class.
* Tailwind of Ironclad Magic - Arcane spell failure chance for wearing armor is reduced by 20% for you and your party members. When a spell is cast it does bonus damage equal to 3% for each 1% of their arcane spell failure, before reductions, even if it's not an arcane spell.  (Only the description is changed to match the actual effect of the ability)
* Crashing Tailwind - All party members gain a +1 bonus for every 2 character levels (minimum +1) to damage rolls with bludgeoning weapons.
* Tailwind of the Bearded - Each dwarf in your party gains a +1 bonus to Constitution ability score, including themselves. 
In addition, whenever a dwarf hits with a Dwarven War Axe or Dwarven Urgrosh, they deal an additional 1d6 additional damage, this damage is multipled on a critical hit.
* Caustic Tailwind - All acid damage dealt by your party members is increased by 25%. 
In addition all party members gain the ability to throw Acid Bombs like an alchemist an unlimited amount of times.
* Frigid Tailwind - All cold damage dealt by your party members is increased by 25%. 
In addition all enemies within 10 feet of any party member are affected by difficult terrain and have a -1 to reflex saves, this penalty increases by 1 every 5 character levels.
* Sparkling Tailwind - All electricity damage dealt by your party members is increased by 25%.
In addition you can cast Call Lighting as a swift action that scales with your character level.
* Searing Tailwind - All fire damage dealt by your party members is increased by 25%. 
In addition all party members gain the ability to cast Fire Bolt as if they had the Fire Domain an unlimited amount of times.
* Howling Tailwind - All sonic damage dealt by your party members is increased by 50%.
* Tailwind of Elven Nimbleness - All elves in your party gain a bonus on initiative rolls equal to their character level.
In addition, all Elven Curved Blades have their critical hit range increased by one.
* Slashing Tailwind - All party members gain a +1 bonus for every 2 character levels (minimum +1) to damage rolls with slashing weapons.
* Tailwind of Fists - Unarmed strikes made by your party members gain a +1 bonus on attack rolls and deal one additional die of the same type as the primary one (1d6 becomes 2d6, 2d6 becomes 3d6).
In addition all unarmed attacks deal damage using the damage die of the next highest category (For example d10 becomes a 2d8).

* Added Kill All hotkey to cheats.
```

Description:
# Champion-Feats
Stack the deck in your favour, if you want

Adds a series of "Champion" feats that will stack the game in your favour, in exchange for paying a feat slot for them. Obviously not based in tabletop. Or any strong sense of game balance.

Specifically adds:

Champion Protection - adds a +1/+2/+3 AC bonus depending on whether you're wearing light, medium, or heavy armour. Scales as you increase in character level, up to +24 AC when wearing Heavy Armour with a level 40 character.

Champion Guard - adds a +5 DR/- bonus. Every 5th level increases it by another +5.

Champion Aim - adds a +1 attack bonus to any weapon. Increases by +2 for every two levels starting at level 3.

Champion Saves - adds +2 per level to all saving throws

Champion Skills - adds a +1 bonus to all skill checks. Increases by +1 for every two levels starting at level 3. This can be toggled to add directly to skill ranks if desired, avoiding issues with untrained skill checks and checks against skill ranks that ignore bonuses.

Champion Strikes - adds +1 damage to any weapon attacks. Increases by +1 for every three levels starting at level 4.

Champion Spell Blasts - adds +1 damage to spell attacks. Increases by +1 for every three levels starting at caster level 4.

Champion Spell Force - adds +1 to the DCs of your spells. Increases by +1 for every caster level.

Champion Spell Penetration - adds half your caster level to the spell penetration stat of your spells. If you also take the basic Spell Penetration feat, this increases to a full caster level bonus.

You can adjust whether these should be considered normal feats or Mythic feats if you want to make it a bit harder for you in a playthrough you're using this mod in.

All Champion feat bonuses can be modified, to not only change the bonus provided but also how many level steps are required per bonus increase i.e. +1 every two levels or +5 every level.

**How to install**

1. Download and install [Unity Mod Manager](https://github.com/newman55/unity-mod-manager), make sure it is at least version 0.23.0
2. Run Unity Mod Manager and set it up to find Wrath of the Righteous
3. Download the Champion Feats mod
4. Install the mod by dragging the zip file from step 5 into the Unity Mod Manager window under the Mods tab

**How to build** (updated)
Now requires you first create an environment variable, called WrathInstallDir, containing the path to the base Wrath folder. All Wrath includes are now relative to that value.

**Thanks**

Vek17 and their Tabletop Tweaks mod, couldn't understand how to actually do some of this stuff I couldn't dissect and take apart how your mod worked.

### This is no longer in active development. I will maintain compatibility with patches and fix major bugs, but I am not adding new features.
 
 # Character Options+

Adds character build options from the tabletop ruleset.

### This mod creates a save dependency. Once you save with this mod enabled it must remain enabled or you will lose access to the save.

## Problems or Suggestions

File a [bug](https://github.com/WittleWolfie/CharacterOptionsPlus/issues/new?template=bug_report.md&title=%5BBUG%5D) or [feature request](https://github.com/WittleWolfie/CharacterOptionsPlus/issues/new?template=feature_request.md&title=%5BFeature%5D). You can also reach me (@WittleWolfie) on [Discord](https://discord.com/invite/owlcat) in the #mod-user-general channel.

## Installation

1. Download and install [Unity Mod Manager](https://github.com/newman55/unity-mod-manager) (min v0.23)
2. Install [ModFinder](https://github.com/Pathfinder-WOTR-Modding-Community/ModFinder) and use it to search for Character Options+
3. Click "Install"
    * If you don't have [TabletopTweaks-Core](https://github.com/Vek17/TabletopTweaks-Core) and [ModMenu](https://github.com/WittleWolfie/ModMenu) already, install them using ModFinder

I also recommend installing [TabletopTweaks-Base](https://github.com/Vek17/TabletopTweaks-Base) and [TabletopTweaks-Reworks](https://github.com/Vek17/TabletopTweaks-Reworks). They are not required but I developed the mod using them and there may bugs if you use it without them.

If you do not want to use ModFinder, download [CharacterOptionsPlus.*.zip](https://github.com/WittleWolfie/CharacterOptionsPlus/releases/latest) and install it using Unity Mod Manager. Make sure to install [TabletopTweaks-Core](https://github.com/Vek17/TabletopTweaks-Core) and [ModMenu](https://github.com/WittleWolfie/ModMenu) as well.

### [Troubleshooting and Feedback](#problems-or-suggestions)

## Base Game Changes (Optional)

* Classes with Animal Companions get Share Spells
* Dreadful Carnage requires Furious Focus instead of Dazzling Display
* Implosion replaces the Tsunami bonus spell granted by the Destruction Domain
* Only a single Draconic Bloodline can be selected
* Only a single Elemental Bloodline can be selected
* The Winter Patron spell list more closely matches the tabletop version

## Bug Fixes

* Heavenly Fire can be used 3 + Charisma Modifier times per day instead of just 3
* Lord Beyond the Grave buff can bet set to permanent, preventing lag / encumberance issues while walking around
* Serpent's Fang poison DC is calculated correctly
* Serpent Friend grants +3 to Perception instead of +2, matching the feature description
* Evasion can be selected as a Slayer's Advanced Talent

## Reporting Problems

### First, go to Settings > Mods > Character Options+ and turn on "Enable Detailed Logs"

**Follow this guide: [So you want to report a WotR mod bug?](https://github.com/Pathfinder-WOTR-Modding-Community/MewsiferConsole/blob/main/ModBugReports.md)** Ideally include a save file.

1. Use [ModFinder](https://github.com/Pathfinder-WOTR-Modding-Community/ModFinder) to install [Mewsifer Console](https://github.com/Pathfinder-WOTR-Modding-Community/MewsiferConsole) and Mewsifer Console Menu
2. Reproduce the issue in-game
3. Open Settings > Mods > Mewsifer Console and select "Mod Bug Report"
    * ![Mewsifer Console Menu screenshot](https://github.com/WittleWolfie/CharacterOptionsPlus/blob/main/screenshots/bug_report.png)
4. File an [issue on GitHub](https://github.com/WittleWolfie/CharacterOptionsPlus/issues/new?template=bug_report.md&title=%5BBUG%5D) and attach the generated bug report
5. Include your save file in the bug report
    * Saves are stored in `%UserProfile%\AppData\LocalLow\Owlcat Games\Pathfinder Wrath Of The Righteous\Saved Games`

### Known Issues

* [Some buffs do not work with BubbleBuffs](https://github.com/WittleWolfie/CharacterOptionsPlus/issues/76)
    * Also AoE indicators are not enabled in BubbleTweaks by default
* Winter Witch's Frozen Caress hex does not apply DC increases from things like Elemental Focus; this will probably never be fixed. It does apply the bonus from Winter Witch's Ice Magic.

### Mod Options

![Mod options screenshot](https://github.com/WittleWolfie/CharacterOptionsPlus/blob/main/screenshots/settings.png)

This mod uses [Mod Menu](https://github.com/WittleWolfie/ModMenu), settings are in the game settings: Settings > Mods > Character Options+. They are not available in UMM.

All settings changes require a restart to take effect.

You can use options to disable any feature added. This will:

* Prevent the feature from being selectable
* Remove any effect from the feature
* Remove any changes to existing mechanics

This will not:

* Remove the feature from characters (but it will not work)
* Grant a replacement feature for characters who have it

Description:
# Combat Relief -- Crusade and Random Encounters

My continuation of [Combat Relief -- Crusade and Random Encounters](https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/mods/40)

## Download

I recommend using [Modfinder](https://github.com/Pathfinder-WOTR-Modding-Community/ModFinder/releases) to download WotR mods. 

But if you don't want to, here are the links for manual download (**Install only one, not both**):  
- ### Latest version. Requires [ModMenu](https://github.com/CasDragon/ModMenu/releases).  
[**LINK**](https://github.com/alterasc/CombatRelief/releases/latest)

- ### Old version without ModMenu dependency   
In case you don't want to install ModMenu. Less functions, but deals with crusade the same.    
[**LINK**](https://github.com/alterasc/CombatRelief/releases/download/1.3.1/CombatRelief-1.3.1.zip)

## How to install:

1. Use Unity Mod Manager.
2. Remove 1.2.1 version of Combat Relief if you have it.
3. Install ModMenu.
4. Install this mod.

## Functionality

- ### Autowin of crusade battles  
Crusaders' armies always win autoresolve. Don't forget to enable crusade setting "Run the tactical combat automatically".

- ### Avoid random encounters   
Makes your party always avoid random encounters. Story encounters during travel are unaffected by the mod.

- ### Prevent Corruption  
When enabled corruption is not gained during rest.

- ### Skill roll modification (version 2.1.0+)
Allows to set on each skill if you want to roll normally/take 10/take 20.  
Can be set to work out of combat only.
Disabled by default.

- ### Teleport to skeleton mechant button (version 2.2.0+)
Teleports you to skeleton merchant random encounter area.
Has a check for game being main campaign, but other than that will teleport out of any situation and act. Don't use it to get there when you're not supposed to.   
So to be safe use it only when you're on global map.

## Settings

Any and all functions can be disabled in Options -> Mods -> CombatRelief. (Or in UMM if you're on version 1.3.1)    
By default all functions are enabled.   
Settings can be save-specific. Meaning if you change them in loaded game, that will affect only this save. If you change them while in Main Menu, that's sets default for all saves where they are not overwritten by save-specific settings.     
Settings affect game immediately, no restart is required.

## Credits

BtB/streikeferret - original Combat Relief mod creator

Permission from him:

> Anyone who wants to continue this mod is free to reverse engineer my existing DLLs.

FAQ
-----------
Q: I don't like feature X, can you remove it? \
A: The ingame menu has a list of all patches. You can click them and restart the game to effectively get rid of any feature. You may not be able to load your save, if you already picked feats which are generated by said patch.

Q: Can you make feature X? \
A: At the moment I have enough ideas to fill out my coding hobby. If the scope is small or it is directly related to one of my existing features, then go ahead a open a Github ticket.

Q: What are the options in red? \
A: These cannot be disabled during a playthrough. They become save permanent. I am working to make the menu more clear.

Build
-----------
* Clone repo
* Create a copy of Directory.Build.props.default named Directory.Build.props.user
* Open and edit Directory.Build.props.user with your game location
* Start solution, switch to Debug configuration, then build (even if project throws errors)

Name: Demonology
Author: Big Daddy Shmee
About: Allows you to take feats from level 1 that gives you the ability to summon demons, that grows in power as you level, giving you access quickly to very powerful summons for your level.
Description:
"Unleash the true power of demonic summoning in Pathfinder: Wrath of the Righteous with the Demonology: Demon Summoning Mod. This mod expands your summoning capabilities, allowing you to call forth a vast array of demons from the game. Enhance your summoner's prowess with additional feats, ensuring your infernal army remains formidable even in the late game. Perfect for players seeking the thrill of commanding a legion of powerful demons, this mod brings the Malconvoker or Evil Summoner archetype to its fullest potential. Embrace the darkness and dominate your foes with unparalleled summoning power!"

Install via Unity Mod Manager.

This is a mod I had made to suit my personal preferred playthrough a few years ago, that now I am uploading. It's still very unfinished though if people enjoy it, perhaps more work can be put into the mod. There are certain feats that don't apply to the Demon Summoning itself, like Added Summons and Superior Summoning. For some reason, it doesn't recognize those feats and won't add additional summons. Keep in mind as well, this mod is not about balance, its a power fantasy. You are the main character of the game, it all revolves around you. Take that to heart and use your summoning abilities as much or as little as you want, finally you can summon like the game revolves around you. Will require Toybox in order take direct control of your summons.

From level 1 you can summon demons if you take the feat : Apprentice Demonology. This ability expands and changes as you level, from Demonic Art 1 at 1st level, Demonic Art 2 at 3rd level, and Demonic art 3 at 5th level. Each Art unlocks more demons, and turns attempts to summon previous lower level demons into summoning multiples.

This is how progression works, each of the creatures you can summon is based on their CR. Its designed so that, each summon you can use can be actually useful in the setting in which you find yourself. By the end of the game normally, you can summon a Balor for example at the end of the Demon Mythic Path. Big whoop, a Balor at that point in the game is entirely pointless and inconsequential to everything going on. Here, every summon you get should have a big impact on the current area of the game at the current level you are. I find that a lot of these are ever so slightly balanced by the fact the demons you're summoning are fighting other demons more often than not, having to hit through high AC's and damage reduction. 

There are also 2 additional powerful feats you can take to further power up your demons. Improved Augment Summoning, and Greater Augment Summoning. Improved gives a +8 Profane bonus to STR, DEX, CON, and a +4 bonus to AC, Attack bonus, all saving throws, and immunity to fear for all your summoned creatures. Greater increases that to +12 for stats, and +6 to AC, AB, all saving throws. These feats are really your only shot at having these summons be able to somewhat stand their ground against endgame mythic demons.

All summons last 1 minute per character level, and you use each ability per day equal to your charisma modifier, to a minimum of 1. There is no summoning limit.

Progression :

Level 1 - Access to Apprentice Demonology

Demonic Art 1 - Summon 1 Dretch, Cambion, or Quasit.

Level 3 - Upgrades to Demonic Art 2 - Summon 1 Vermlek, Abricandiul, or Shir, or 1d3 of the previous level.

Level 5 - Upgrades to Demonic Art 3 - Summon 1 Brimorak, Incubus, or Babau, 1d3 of DA2, or 1d4+! of DA1.

It should be noted here you keep DA3 as a permanent ability. DA4 is a seperate ability.

Level 7 : Access to Adept Demonology.

Demonic Art 4 - Summon 1 Shadow Demon, Succubus, Nabasu, or Vrock, 1d3 of DA3, or 1d4+1 of DA2

Level 9 - Upgrades to Demonic Art 5 - Summon 1 Derakni, Kalavakus, Gibrileth, or Retriever, 1d3 DA4, 1d4+1 DA3, loses access DA2 Summons.

Level 11 - Upgrades to Demonic Art 6 - Summon 1 Coloxus, Omox, Glabrezu, Oolioddroo, Nalfeshnee, or Painajai, 1d3 DA5, or 1d4+1 DA4. Loses DA3

This is a seperate ability from DA7 and DA3.

Level 13 - Access to Master Demonology

Demonic Art 7 - Summon 1 Marileth, Lilitu, or Vavakia, 1d3 of DA6, or 1d4+1 of DA5

Level 15 - Demonic Art 8 - Summon 1 Balor, Gallu, or Vrolikai, 1d3 DA7, 1d4 DA6, Loses DA5

Level 17 - Serperate Ability Demonic Art 9 - 1d3 Balor, Gallu, or Vrolikai, 1d4 DA8

Use the summons how you like, even though you have access to them all, perhaps you're RPing a Demon worshipper and only have access to specific types.

Lastly, a big thanks to 2 modders than helped me a lot. Perunq, whom I commissioned to create the mod, and then a few years later when I desired to play again, Microsoftenator who kindly updated the mod and will work on possible bug fixes. Without them this mod wouldn't have been possible. Cheers and enjoy!

# Ebon's Content Mod
This mod was created to add new content from tabletop to Wrath of the Righteous that wasn't represented in the other major content mods. This requires [TabletopTweaks-Core](https://github.com/Vek17/TabletopTweaks-Core "TabletopTweaks-Core"), [WrathPatches](https://github.com/microsoftenator2022/WrathPatches "WrathPatches") (I'm not entirely sure why, but Micro says it does, so it does), and is partially dependent upon [TabletopTweaks-Base](https://github.com/Vek17/TabletopTweaks-Base "TabletopTweaks-Base"), though it will work without it.

If you want to read through my rationale for any implementation decisions I had to make along the way, please see my [Modder Notes](https://github.com/EdgarEbonfowl/EbonsContentMod/blob/main/ModderNotes.md "Modder Notes").

## Added Races
This mod adds the following races to the game and they should work like the default races. Note, I have not completed a playthrough with these races, so I cannot say for sure that you will not encounter problems. You may experience some strange behavior, especially in dialog, where the race type either is not recognized or, more likely, is recognized as some other race (an NPC calling your drow character an elf, for instnace). That being said, if you encounter bugs, please report them!

**If you don't see your favorite race here:** the way I do races involves cloning, recoloring, and then cobbling together base game assets (think Mr. Potatohead plus a paint brush), so only races that can be made from vanilla assets are included here. That means no tengu, no catfolk, etc. If you want me to make a race that would look acceptable with vanilla assets let me know OR if you have some 3D modeling skills and want to submit custom assets, I can make your race. Currently, only the goblin is using anything custom.

**Note on colors:** the method I use to add custom color textures to the game causes my custom color ramps for skin color, eye color, hair color, etc. to not show their color swatch in the character creator, showing up as empty circles instead. I promise, they still work, just click through them and you will see.

Integrated arcane discoveries:

## Ability Fixes
- **Come And Get Me!** barbarian power now works correctly with the skald's raging song. The vanilla version only affected the skald, not teammates. It will be disabled any time a teammate steps out of the song's aura then steps back in, so be aware of that.
- **Discordant Voice** feat now applies to any ally within the area of effect of any bard song rather than just the beneficial ones.

## Mechanics Fixes/Changes
- Multi-projectile spells (Hellfire Ray, Scorching Ray, etc.) that should be able to assign projectiles to different targets per tabletop rules will now switch to a new target if the current target dies, rather than just dumping all the extra projectiles into the first target's corpse. All tabletop targeting rules are respected - for instance, no two targets can be more than 30 feet apart for Hellfire Ray. There was some early inconsistency here, but I think I have corrected any flaws in the implementation and my current testing seems to indicate that this consistently works as intended - please submit an issue report if you find otherwise.

## Installation
1. Download and install [Unity Mod Manager](https://github.com/newman55/unity-mod-manager).
2. Drop the zip file from the relaease into the "Drop Zip Files Here" panel in the Unity Mod Manager UI in the "Mods" tab.

**Note:** This requires the Doorstop installation method for Unity Mod Manager, most people do it this way, but if yours is installed using the Assembly method you can do one of these (you can see which method you used at the bottom of the "Install" tab):
1. Uninstall UMM and reinstall using the Doorstop method
2. Use WrathPatches to upgrade the game's Harmony version
3. Copy `Harmony` from `Wrath_Data\Managed\UnityModManager` to `Wrath_Data\Managed`

## Other Mods
* This version will not play nice with Worldcrawl. If you use that mod, I have released a Worldcrawl-compatible version over on [Nexus Mods](https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/mods/758?tab=files "Nexus Mods"). The Worldcrawl version does not have the Collegiate Initiate archetype, but is otherwise unchanged. I will work on a solution that preserves the archetype, but for now, use that version if you use Worldcrawl.
* The cloned parts created for the new races will not show up as editable options in Visual Adjustments 2. Everything else still will work fine. Maybe one day there will be a meeting of the minds to sort this issue out, but for now, know that is a limitation.

* DarthParametric for contributing the custom assets for the goblin model, generally giving me a lot of help, and having a cool screen name.

Description:
# Ebon's Unfixer Mod
If you're like me and you have been playing Wrath of the Righteous for a couple years off-and-on and each time you return to the game you find out Owlcat "fixed" a feature that you built around and now your characters are markedly worse, this mod is for you. The intent of this mod is merely to revert/unfix some of the fixes that Owlcat implemented since launch which haven't been reverted elsewhere. This requires [TabletopTweaks-Core](https://github.com/Vek17/TabletopTweaks-Core "TabletopTweaks-Core").

## The Unfixes
* **Critical Threat Range Calculation:** the way threat range is calculated is restored to the glorious time before the recent patch that "fixed" it. Gravesinger? Great again. Trickster critical feats? Great again.
* **Bane Of Spirit:** remember when the Bane of Spirit ring allowed you to change any ally's damage into force damage with a free action? Do you hate that it got made into a swift action ability? Well now it is a free action again! Not a full revert to when it made *everything* into force damage (infinite force damage cave fangs anyone?), but a big step in that direction.
* **Shatter Defenses:** the intimidation melee ability *par excellence* before it got "fixed" and actually required you to hit the target before making them flat-footed. Now it checks for shaken/frightened before the attack roll again. Beautiful.
* **Wide Sweep:** the quintessential crowd killer before Owlcat "fixed" it, changing its AOE weapon damage to 2d4 damage. Well, now it's back to the glory days of exploding throngs of hapless kobolds with cleave/cleaving finish so you can channel your inner grim reaper.
* **Repurpose:** the mythic spell that made the lich feel like the master of undeath used to be worthwhile on higher difficulties before it was "fixed." Now, Repurpose preserves the difficulty-specific bonuses on your raised undead minions once again.

## Installation

Description:
# Enduring rework - mod for Pathfinder: Wrath of the Righteous

Changes Enduring spells and Greater Enduring Spells mythic abilities to be the following

Enduring Spells
```
Prerequisite: Metamagic (Extend Spell)

You've learned a way to prolong the effects of your beneficial extended spells

Benefit: 
Effects of your spells on your allies cast with extend metamagic applied that should last longer than 1 minute but shorter than 10 minutes last 10 minutes.
Effects that should last longer than 10 minutes but shorter than 1 hour last 1 hour.
```

Greater Enduring Spells
```
You've mastered a way to prolong your beneficial spells.

Benefit: 
In addition to existing benefits effects of your spells on your allies cast with extend metamagic that should last longer than an hour are permanent.
```

### Note:
**Unlike base game where "longer than X" is "longer or equal" here it's actually longer as written.**

So 1 minute extended spell will stay 1 minute. 1 minute 12 seconds will become 10 minutes.

Cave Fangs, Call Lightning, Call Lightning Storm won't become permanent. Sorry if you already theorized this.

Does not introduce save dependency, so you can remove it any time.

If used together with Tabletop-Reworks, it will overwrite TT-Reworks changes to Enduring Spells.

Description:
This is a mod to add additional slides to the epilogue for Wrath of The Righteous based on a plurality of quests and NPCs that do not have slides in the vanilla game. The mod has two "modes." In the first mode (Integrated), the slides will appear between existing slides. In the second mode (Extra Slides), the slides will appear at the end of the vanilla slides. Integrated mode additionally will add some alterations to existing slides, mostly related to giving additional reactivity to companions in the secret ending. You select the mode you want to use via answers during the epilogue. You can activate Integrated mode on the first slide. You can activate Extra Slides mode (or choose to not see the epilogue expansion) on a new slide that appears after the companion section.

Be aware that this mod adds a LOT of new slides. Checking with some of the tools I use for datamining indicates that I have added 235+ potential slides with 1225+ lines between those new slides. It is impossible to trigger everything in a single play through and some of them will replace existing slides, but 50%+ of the slides might be possible in a completionist run. For comparison, by my count there are 101 slides (81 normal end, 20 Aeon end) in the base game v. 2.1. So this mod will triple the number of available slides.

A complete list of the new slides and their requirements can be found at the following locations:
[url=https://www.reddit.com/r/Pathfinder_Kingmaker/comments/15bcvz6/expanded_epilogue_mod_slide_guide_part_1/]Reddit, Part 1[/url], has spoiler tags
[url=https://www.reddit.com/r/Pathfinder_Kingmaker/comments/15he5gh/expanded_epilogue_mod_slide_guide_part_2/]Reddit, Part 2[/url], has spoiler tags
[url=https://docs.google.com/document/d/1qiST8ZFFqmRAFXgv6sSgZC9brWsRBtU3MzKk0A2HmYI/edit?usp=sharing]Google Docs[/url], does not have spoiler tags

Most recent tested version: 2.6.0n (everything appears to be working)

[b]HOW TO INSTALL[/b]

1. Download and install [Unity Mod Manager](https://github.com/newman55/unity-mod-manager)
2. Run Unity Mod Manager and set it up to find Wrath of the Righteous
3. Download the Expanded Epilogue Mod
4. Install the mod by dragging the zip file from step 3 into the Unity Mod Manager window under the Mods tab or unzip the zip and move the Epilogue folder into the Mods folder in the Wrath root directory

[b]MOD VERSION HISTORY[/b]

1.3.0 - Russian translation added. Added a blank line at the end of each slide (including base game) to prevent letters like 'j' from being cut off. Fixed conditions related to Lathimas and Harmattan. Tweaked the conditions for Through the Ashes slides, which I think should allow it to identify imported states where all the survivors died (triggers on DLC2_LowFantasy)
1.2.3 - Improved conditions for Liotr's slide. Changed references to Dracoliches to Raveners since Raveners are the Pathfinder counterpart. Changed the conditions on some Logistics slides to catch a scenario where you used Toybox to sequence break. Added a condition on Camellia's abandon Aeon slide so you need to complete her Chapter 4 quest to get the good variant. Minor tweak to Lann and Wenduag logic for secret reasons. Did some code tweaks to clean out stupid warnings about failed validation. Apparently the evaluators wanted names. >.>
1.2.2 - Update to the conditions for slides for party members that leave the party so the slides are also triggered when they leave Legends that revert to their old Mythic Paths. Corrected an error that could cause Sendri's slide to trigger when it shouldn't.
1.2.1 - Update to the conditions for the Pleasure Slave slide as it wasn't working right. Also improved detection for Kyado dying off screen in Chapter 5.
1.2.0 - Update for version 2.3, adds four new slides for the update including the Black Blade, adds additional variants for Lann and Arue keyed off of DLC variables, and adds a new slide for an Eidolon if you are playing as a Summoner (mod only). Additionally, added images for a few characters that were lacking full sized versions (see known issues). Finally, fixed a minor issue where importing from DLC5 was causing the DLC2 survivors are dead slides that was introduced in a previous WotR update.
1.1.0 - Update for version 2.2, adds 10 new slides including Bismuth, the three new "animal companions," and DLC5 story specific slides.
1.0.0 - Full release on Nexus. Tested on 2.1.4v
0.1.0 - Beta release for code testing. Editing process is still ongoing.

[b]KNOWN ISSUES[/b]

The horse, ghost horse, blizzard elemental, night hag "animal companion," Hippogriff, Sithhud, Razmir, and Black Blade character portraits have no full sized version of their portraits in the files. After testing, I've decided to use their half-sized portraits because I think they look fine and a slightly stretched picture is better than no picture. If you are sensitive to pixilation, I'm sorry. Note: The Black Blade only has a small portrait, so it is stretched a bit more than the others.

[b]MOD COMPATIBILITY[/b]

Expanded Epilogue should be compatible with nearly all mechanic focused mods. If someone someday makes a mod that adds a Mythic Path, that could potentially cause major compatibility issues. Hypothetically, minor issues could also arise if a mod were to add new versions of any of the items that are checked for (e.g., the crusade relics), but at most that should just result in a slide being skipped.

Story expansion mods should all play nice with Extra Slides mode as it has a minimal footprint. Integrated mode will not show any newly added slides from other mods unless compatibility has been added. Currently I have added compatibility so that slides from the Woljiff Romance Mod and the Camellia Romance Expanded End will show if the corresponding mods are installed. I will do my best to add compatibility to any future story expansion mods I become aware of. To anyone working on story expansion mods, give me a heads up before it is released and I can try and add day-1 compatibility to your story-expansion mod.

I cannot add compatibility with the Socothbenoth Mini Romance Expansion mod as there is no way for me to detect that it has been installed. So if you install that mod and trigger the Socothbenoth fling, you will potentially end up with two ending slides that mention him.

A slide has been added for the Summoner mod.

Description:
# Formation Fixer for More Party Slots

## About A mod for Owlcat's Pathfinder: Wrath of the Righteous. Adjusts the formation templates and UI to allow for larger parties, intended for use in conjunction with ADDB's [More Party Slots](https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/mods/694) mod. Supports up to 24 party members, including pets (double the provision of vanilla). By default, the game only handles up to 12 entities in a party formation. Anything beyond that and characters are forced into the same position on top of one another. This mod edits all the custom formations to allow for more characters, adding an additional 12 positions to bring the total to 24. It also adjusts the scaling of the character portraits in the formation manager UI to allow for more space to fit larger parties. Additionally, the settings of the Auto formation have been tweaked to try and better accommodate large parties, and maximise the use of the UI space for it in the formation manager. ## Install 1. Download and install [Unity Mod Manager](https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/21) and set it up for WOTR ("Pathfinder Second Adventure"). 1. Download the latest version of the mod from [Github](https://github.com/DarthParametric/WOTR_Formation_Fixer/releases/latest), [Nexus Mods](https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/mods/836), or via [ModFinder](https://github.com/Pathfinder-WOTR-Modding-Community/ModFinder/releases/latest). 1. Install the mod manually, via UMM, or via ModFinder. 1. Run your game. ## Notes - More Party Slots is not strictly required, but there's little point in using this mod unless you have a party beyond the vanilla 6. Although it may prove useful for vanilla 6 + 6 pets. - If you _are_ using More Party Slots, the use of [More Party View Slots](https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/mods/692) is also recommended. - The vanilla game has a hard limit of 20 units in the party, which this mod has expanded to 24. While More Party Slots might let you add more units beyond that, doing so will cause the game to crash when loading an area with all of them in the party. While the cap itself is easy to raise, each new party member would require a new set of formation positions. - The formation manager UI scaling has been adjusted to fit larger formations more comfortably and give you more room to customise their positions. The various patches involved to do so though may cause some unexpected wonkiness, so use the Restore to Default button if things get messed up. - The Auto formation does not handle large parties very well. I have tried to adjust its behaviour, with limited success. However, the formation manager UI tab for it does now dynamically adjust the formation position to try and maximise the available space. - Should work with both the keyboard/mouse and controller UI schemes. ## Thanks & Acknowledgements - microsoftenator2022 - Helped out with creating the first transpiler (which I subsequently rewrote, so all terrible code and bugs are my fault) and corrected some of my syntax goofs. He also pointed out where the game was capping the max formation array size, leading to crashes. - ADDB - Provided the postfix patch for scaling the usable area of the formation grid back up to the correct size after other UI scaling. - Everyone in the `#mod-dev-technical` channel of the Owlcat Discord server for various modding-related discussions and suggestions, help troubleshooting issues, and answering general questions.

Name: Full Bore Bismuth
Author: Badger
About: Makes Bismuth a tad more useful by rearranging what feats he learns and making him not take the -4 level penalty.
Description:
This is an "owlcat mod", as in it's created by editing existing blueprints and as such it's installed a little bit differently than other mods.

[size=4]To install:[/size]

1. Go to Users/Username/AppData/LocalLow/Owlcat Games/Pathfinder Wrath of the Righteous

2. Place "OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json" in this folder

3. Create a new folder called "Modifications" and place the mod in there.

Note: If you are using Windows check the "View" tab and make sure "Hidden Items" is checked to see the folder "appdata".

Note 2: If you already have an OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json file, instead add ,"FullBoreBismuth" inside that file.

Note 3: Multiple owlcat mods should look like this in your OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json        ["FullBoreBismuth","Other Mod"]




[size=4]For Automated Installation:

[size=3]https://github.com/Pathfinder-WOTR-Modding-Community/ModFinder



[/size][/size]I'd like to thank the people over at the Owlcat Games discord for putting up with the questions that led to me starting to make mods, and Kurufinve in particular, whom must have an endless supply of patience.

Name: Gracious Friendships
Author: Gvenewour & Ameistris
About: 'Gracious Friendships' is a lore-friendly narrative mod that adds new dialogue options for companions and NPCs. It expands character interactions throughout the game and fixes some issues with romance flags.

1. What's inside this mod?[/size]

[size=3]This mod adds new dialogue options for companions and NPCs. It overhauls and expands character interactions throughout the game and includes new content for romance and friendship interaction.We added your and your companions' reactions to Hulrun's murder, meeting Areelu, surviving the Arena, and other plot-heavy moments.
Your companions no longer ignore someone's doppelganger in a certain basement; we are especially proud of that part.

This is a fan-made modification put together because we love and respect the original game and its characters. It's not for sale.
We are bound by lore and content in WotR, and we do not intend to monetize this mod and its content.
We also thank the Kickstarter backers for reaching the Modding Support stretch goal and Owlcat Games for [url=https://github.com/OwlcatOpenSource/WrathModificationTemplate]publishing the Modification Template[/url].
[/size]

[size=3]This is some content in the mod (careful, there may be spoilers):  

[/size][list]
[*][size=3][size=3][chapter 4: ending][/size][/size]
[size=3][size=3]Fixed the post-Colyphyr discussion with the companions who were left at the Nexus: you no longer need to click [Talk to your companions] 50+ times to see all the replies.[/size]
[size=3]If some of the romanced companions (Daeran, Lann, Arueshalae, Camellia, or Sosiel) were left in the camp, their lines will reference their respective romances.[/size]

[/size][*][size=3][chapter 4: meeting areelu] [/size]
[size=3]Companions rightfully react to Areelu's appearance at Nocticula's palace.[/size][size=3][/size][size=3](Seelah, Regill, Ember, Lann, Dearan)

[/size] [*][size=3][chapter 4: post-Arena] [/size]
[size=3]After your daring escape from the Arena, you can discuss it back at the Nexus with Seelah (gives you a bottle of mead), Greybor (references his respect level), romanced Lann, romanced Arueshalae, romanced Camellia and romanced Sosiel (his lines can reference his personal quest stage and Trever's fate).[/size][size=3]
[/size][size=3][size=3]
[/size][*][size=3][chapter 4: Camellia's Q2] [/size]
[size=3]During Camellia's quest in Ten Thousand Delights, Herrax gives you a key to the farthest room in the basement. However, if you break into the [i]closest [/i]room, [/size][size=3]you'll see someone's really disturbing doppelganger. Your companions now react to it. After you leave that room, ask Herrax about it. Her comment will mention a random companion from your active party (except Ember). Because everyone deserves a chance to be disgusted (Regill disapproves).

[/size]... and more!

[size=3]Please check the 'Full list of added interactions' section to see what was added to this mod so far. Beware of spoilers![/size]

[/size][/list][size=3][size=3]---
[b]NOTE:[/b] We are currently adding more content for Chapter 5, so if you have any ideas for some lore-friendly dialogue injections, please let us know!

[/size][size=3][b]BUG REPORTING:[/b] Let us know if any mentioned moments in the list of interactions do not work as intended.[/size]

[size=5]3. Localizations [/size]

[size=3]This mod is a work-in-progress, so its main content and its translations are created and distributed separately by different creators.
Existing localizations of this mod are distributed in zip archives with this structure:
[code]ModnameLANG.zip﻿
|_____ Modname
 |_____ Localization
  |_____ enGB|deDE|frFR|esES|ruRU|zhCN.json[/code]
For example, the Chinese localization for 'Gracious Friendships' mod looks like this:
[code]GraciousFriendshipsCN.zip﻿
|_____ GraciousFriendships
 |_____ Localization
  |_____ zhCN.json[/code]
Users can extract localization archives either manually or automatically, please follow the Installation/Uninstallation instructions for your preferred platform.[/size]

[size=4]4.1 [size=4]Automatic mod and localizations installation via Owlcat Template mod installer (Windows, Linux)[/size][/size]
[size=3]
      Link on NexusMods:  [size=3][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/mods/440]Owlcat Template mod installer[/url][/size]

      This is our own minimalistic offline installer that we uploaded when our NexusMods users got tired of manual installation.
     
      Just select the mod archive or drag it into the program window for a quick mod installation or upgrade.
      It also allows to install the localization archives the same way (just drag and drop them).

      Supports x64 versions of Windows (7, 8, 10) and Linux (checked in Ubuntu 22.04 and Linux Mint)
[/size]

[size=4]4.2 Automatic installation via ModFinder (Windows) [/size][size=3]
[/size][size=3][size=3]
     This UMM-based online tool allows users to browse and install UMM and Owlcat Template mods hosted on NexusMods and Github.
     Check the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/mods/367]ModFinder's page[/url] for more information and details.
     
     For the English version of the game, you don't need another installer if you already use ModFinder: the latest version of ModFinder supports our mod.

     However, if you use localizations other than English, you will need to manually extract and install localization files as described  in the 'Manual installation of localizations' section.

Name: Great Radiance
Author: BurlyWurly
About: Changes Radiance from a Longsword into a Greatsword. There are nearly thirty alternate versions including Starknife, Bastard Sword, Falcata, Longspear, and Dueling Sword. Don't see your MC's preferred weapon? Just ask.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Icon substitution figured out. Radiance has a shiny greatsword icon in base/good versions, and a dark one in bad versions. New model as well.

The +6 versions of both Good and Bad Radiance have been updated with the +6 Radiance enchantments introduced in July 2022. This now causes them to correctly possess their 'Holy' and 'Bane Living' properties respectively.
Some versions of Radiance did not have model substitution implemented.
Release version! Model substitution exists; Visual Adjustments mod no longer required.
Corrected an error where the descriptive text for +4 Good Radiance was showing that of +6 Bad Radiance and vice versa.
The enhancement bonus of the +2 version of Radiance was inadvertently set to +1. This has been corrected and it now correctly has a +2 enhancement bonus.
Two of the 'Yaniel' versions had broken enhancement bonuses. These have been corrected.
Pre-release version. Radiance functions as a greatsword but requires utilization of the Visual Adjustment mod for proper visuals.

Description:
[b]GreatRadiance

[/b]Availability of unique magical weapons is largely restricted to either longswords or one of the weird exotic weapons like sai's which literally no one wants to use but the game is covered with. There are probably about 20 different named longswords in the game, to maybe 3-4 decent greatswords, arguably the most popular weapon for front-line martials in Pathfinder. And of course, the legendary Paladin weapon that plays a special role in the entire adventure...is also a longsword, because why make anyone want to actually use one of those 20 other ones?

If you're like me you were profoundly disappointed when you discovered that the game would force you to choose between playing with the weapon you wanted to or having to pass the game's iconic sword to a companion. Especially since in the Adventure Path on which this is based, Radiance is actually supposed to transform into a Paladin's preferred weapon. This mod is my attempt to remedy that. [b]GreatRadiance[/b] changes all versions of Radiance into a greatsword, and gives all magical versions of it the Evil Outsider Bane enchantment for good measure, to make up for the inability to enchant weapons and the absence of the 'Oath of the Crusade' archetype.

[i][b]DISCLAIMER: [/b]This mod is not made for installation with the Unity Mod Manager. [/i]Read the installation instructions very carefully. I am not a C# coder, therefore this mod was made utilizing Owlcat's Wrath Modification Template for Unity. 

[b]Modfinder Installation (Preferred Method): [/b]Download and install [i]Modfinder [/i]by WittleWolfie at:
https://github.com/Pathfinder-WOTR-Modding-Community/ModFinder
Download GreatRadiance, then drag and drop the zip folder onto the "Drag zips here to install" block at the bottom of the Modfinder interface.

[b]Manual Installation Instructions:
*[i]A thorough installation manual in pdf format with extensive screenshot clarification is now available in the 'Files'  section under 'Miscellaneous'.[/i]
1.[/b] Navigate to [i]user-folder[/i]/AppData/LocalLow/Owlcat Games/Pathfinder Wrath Of The Righteous/ and create a new folder named 'Modifications'.
[b]2.[/b] Unzip the mod and place the 'GreatRadiance' folder and all its contents in there.
[b]3.[/b] Create a file named 'OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json' and place it within [i]user-folder[/i]/AppData/LocalLow/Owlcat Games/Pathfinder Wrath Of The Righteous/   [b]
[/b][b]*4. [/b]Open 'OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json' in notepad and add the modification to it by inputting:
{
     "EnabledModifications": ["GreatRadiance"]    
}
[b]5.[/b] Obtain Radiance, either by playing until you find it or loading up a game in which you've already gotten it.
[b]6. [/b]Enjoy! 

*If you're running another Unity-developed Mod such as my BetterBackgrounds mod simultaneously, the syntax looks like this
{
      "EnabledModifications": ["BetterBackgrounds", "GreatRadiance"]
}

[b]Alternate Versions:
[/b]There are numerous alternate versions of GreatRadiance available as optional files which replace Radiance with weapons other than Greatsword. Installation is identical. It is [b]not[/b] possible to run multiple versions of this Mod at the same time. That said, it is simply a matter of swapping out the GreatRadiance folder in the Modifications folder to change between versions.

[b]*[/b]If you convert Radiance to a double weapon, then load up a saved game that already has Radiance and has it equipped on a character, it will break your inventory. You'll need to use Toybox to remove the item altogether, then re-add it and equip it properly.

[b]FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS:
Q: [/b]Help! I've followed the instructions but nothing happened - Radiance is still a longsword.
[b]A: [/b]Doublecheck the 'OwlcatModificationManagerSettings' file you created. Ensuring that file extensions are turned on, is the full name with extensions 'OwlcatModificationManangerSettings.json.txt'? If so, eliminate the '.txt' and that should fix the problem. If it's still not working, hit me up in the comments or over DM and I'll help you troubleshoot.
[b]Q: [/b]My game isn't starting.
[b]A: [/b]There is almost a 100% chance other mods are at fault here. The most common cause until recently was a conflict between AutoBuff and TableTopTweaks.
[b]Q: [/b]What about Natural Attacks/Unarmed Strikes?
[b]A: [/b]Unfortunately this is something I just can't figure out how to do right now. I do genuinely want to bring the option to use Radiance to monks, Paladins of Irori, and the like but it's just not within my ability at the moment. Rest assured I *will* make this option if and when that changes.

Name: Greater Angelic Halo
Author: testlum
About: Improves Improved Angelic Halo
Description:
Improves Improved Angelic Halo.

**Blinding Light**

Any enemy that attacks you for the first time each round must succeed on a Fortitude saving throw (DC = 10 + half your character level + your mythic rank + highest ability modifier) or be blinded for 1d4+1 rounds. On a successful save, the enemy is blinded for 1 round instead.

**Burning Bright**

All demon and undead enemies in range of the Angelic Halo suffer 1d6 holy damage per mythic rank each round.

**Flame of Life**

All allies in range of the Angelic Halo gain fast healing equal to 10 + your mythic rank for 1 round upon taking damage.

**Piercing Rays**

~~All enemies in range of the Angelic Halo suffer a penalty to spell resistance and saving throws equal to 1 + half your mythic rank.~~ Currently bugged!

Name: Homebrew Archetypes
Author: Sigurd
About: Adds archetypes/classes/feats from the Table Top. If an archetype doesn't align with it's TT version some homebrew modifications are made to help it fit in the game. Now includes the Ninja mod
Description:
[size=3][center][b]Bug Reporting:[/b] Let me know if anything doesn't work right or is broken.

[size=4][b]To install:[/b][/size]

1. Go to Users/Username/AppData/LocalLow/Owlcat Games/Pathfinder Wrath of the Righteous

2. Place "OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json" in this folder

3. Create a new folder called "Modifications" and place the mod in there.

Note: If you are using Windows check the "View" tab and make sure "Hidden Items" is checked to see the folder "appdata"

[b]Note 2:[/b] If you already have the OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json in use add       ,"HomebrewArchetypes"      inside the file.

[b]Note 3:[/b] Multiple owlcat mods should look like this in your OwlcatModificationManagerSettings.json        ["HomebrewArchetypes","AC"]




[size=4][b]For Automated Installation:

[/b][size=3]https://github.com/Pathfinder-WOTR-Modding-Community/ModFinder
[/size][b][/b][/size]


[size=6][b]Main Mod:[/b][/size][/center][/size]
[center][b][size=4]Current Archetypes:[/size][/b][/center]
[b](Arcanist)
Blood Arcanist[/b] - An archetype that gives a choice of sorcerer bloodline.
[b]School Savant[/b] - An archetype which gains wizard spell schools.
(Magical Deceiver)[b]False Prophet[/b](Homebrew) - A new Way that adds several divine spells to mix and match in your fusions.

[b](Barbarian)
Hateful Rager[/b] - A half orc archetype that trades some rage powers for favored enemy, is modified from TT version since many of its features just make no sense for the game or have parts not implemented.
[b]Primal Hunter[/b] - Archetype that gains bonuses to ranged attacks when raging.

[b](Bard)[/b]
[b]Arcane Duelist[/b] - Sacrifices some utility to become a stronger martial.
[b]Dervish of Dawn[/b] - (Good Only) Loses Inspire Courage/Greatness/Heroics to selfishly gain bonuses to themselves.
[b]Stonesinger[/b] - A dwarf only archetype.
[b]Strategist[/b](Modded Homebrew - Artemiusl - Baldur's Gate 1 and 2) - An int based bard archetype(Based on Artemiusl's Bardic Wonders mod and converted to pathfinder)
[b]Dancer(Modded Homebrew - Artemiusl - Baldur's Gate 1 and 2)[/b] - A dual wielding martial focused archetype(Based on Artemiusl's Bardic Wonders mod and converted to pathfinder)

[b](Bloodrager)[/b]
[b]Untouchable Rager[/b] - An archetype that gives up spellcasting for spell resistance.
[b]Bloody-Knuckled Rowdy[/b] - An archetype that gives up defenses for unarmed combat.

[b](Cavalier)[/b]
[b]Green Knight[/b] - A non-mounted archetype of cavalier

[b](Cleric)[/b]
[b]Evangelist[/b] - A cleric/bard hybrid archetype. Quite a bit of brewage here since it either became impossible to
accurately make or didn't have any of the spells available.
[b]Undead Lord(Modded)[/b] - Death focused archetype with the new undead companion.
[b]Elder Mythos Cultist[/b] - Embrace madness and the void.

[b](Druid)
Halcyon Druid[/b] - Druid archetype that gives up shapeshifting for more spellcasting power.

[b](Fighter)
Viking[/b] - A fighter archetype that sacrifices armor and weapon training for rages.
[b]Berserker[/b][b](Modded Homebrew - Artemiusl - Baldur's Gate 1 and 2)[/b] - The lower its hp the stronger it gets. Based on Artemiusl's Berserker kit in Artisan's Kitpack

[b](Inquisitor)[/b]
[b]Umbral Stalker[/b] - A stealthy inquisitor archetype

[b](Monk)
Hellcat[/b] - A more durable brawler version of the monk.
[b]Monk of the Mantis[/b] - Archetype that gains some sneak attacks and some extra effects on their stunning blow.

[b](Paladin)
Oathbound - Oath of Vengeance[/b] - A paladin that has more than normal uses of smite, but loses some bonuses on Hand of Justice.
[b]Oathbound - Oath of the People's Council[/b] - A paladin that loses smite for bardic performance.
[b]Wilderness Warden[/b] - Add a small amount of nature theme to the paladin.
[b]Holy Guide[/b] - Archetype gaining favored terrain and the ability to share teamwork feats.
[b]Faithful Wanderer[/b] - A stealthy ranger like paladin

[b](Oracle)
Ancient Lorekeeper[/b] - An elven oracle archetype that exchanges skills/spells from their mystery for a selection of wizard spells.

[b](Ranger)
Wild Stalker[/b] - A ranger archetype that gains the barbarian's ability to rage.
[b]Sword-Devil[/b] - The archetype of Red Sonja in pathfinder. Contains a couple changes
to the class such as dex to damage on slashing fury, but otherwise left
as is.

[b](Rogue)[/b]
[b]Carnivalist(Modded)[/b] - A modified version of the Tabletop Carnivalist adding an animal companion rather than familiar and inspire courage rather than distraction.
[b]Thiefling(Homebrew)[/b] - An archetype made for Woljif making him a spontaneous casting rogue.

[b](Slayer)[/b]
[b]Contract Killer(Homebrew)[/b] - An archetype meant for Greybor based off the Red mantis Assassin PRC.

[b](Sorcerer)[/b]
[b]Eldritch Knight(Modded)[/b] - Same as the wizard.
[b]Arcane Trickster(Modded)[/b] - Arcane Trickster as a sorcerer archetype.

[b](Warpriest)
Sacred Fist[/b] - A monkified version of the warpriest for those that want something different.

[b](Wizard)
Undead Master(Modded)[/b] - A necromancy focused archetype. Is a pet class with the new undead companion.
[b]Eldritch Knight[b](Modded Homebrew - Artemiusl - Baldur's Gate 1 and 2)[/b][/b] - A wizard archetype conversion of the eldritch knight prc based on Artemiusl's Eldritch Knight multiclass kit in Artisan's Kitpack.

[b](Witch)
Scarred Witch Doctor[/b] - An archetype for half orcs that uses constitution as their casting stat(The real un-neutered version). (Now works with Lich hopefully) (Note: It will not remove con when you become a true lich.)

[size=4][b][center](New Classes)[/center][/b][/size]

[b]Investigator[/b] - Finally the Investigator class! (In need of player testing and feedback.)

[b](Investigator Archetypes)[/b]

[b]Jinyiwei[/b] - A hybrid Inquisitor/Investigator archetype.
[b]Questioner[/b] - An archetype replacing alchemy spells with bard spells(is an arcane spellcaster so no casting in armor without relevant feats.)(Also does not lose access to alchemy discoveries due to the limited talent pool(May lose some discoveries as they are not usable? for the current questioner such as infusion.)
[b]Empiricist[/b] - A more skill focused archetype.

[b](NPC)(Classes)[/b]
For all those that want to roleplay a little here are the npcs!
[b]
Adept
Aristocrat
Commoner
Expert
Warrior

Herald(3rd Party - IluzryMage) - [/b]A 3rd party class created by IluzryMage as an alternative to the Omdura class. This class is a cross between paladin/antipaladin/inquisitor/bard. (This is a new class so expect some failures from things I may have missed.)

[b]Ninja[/b] - Ninja as its own class moved from Ninja Class mod. (May have issues from the merging so if something doesn't work right needs to be reported.)

[b]Champion[/b](Homebrew) - The non-alignment paladin using Oaths.

Oath of the Champion - Basic Paladin
Oath of the Unconquered - A defensive focused option
Oath of Self Perfection - A take on the Iroran Paladin

[b]Freedom Fighter(Homebrew)[/b] - A personal class that is providing subclasses for various races. Currently possessing Luckbearer(Halfling) and Demolition Expert(Dwarf in progress), Farstrider(Elf in progress).

[center][b][size=4](Prestige Classes)[/size]﻿[/b][/center]
[b]Razmiran Priest[/b] - A pseudo divine caster prestige class for arcane casters.

[b]Assassin[/b] - Assassin now has Fatalistic Faith(Will continue divine spellcasting progression every 2 assassin levels in exchange for giving up Poison Saves Increase.)

[b]Arcane Trickster[/b] - As per the Tabletop rules Arcane Trickster can now pick a divine spellbook to continue progression on if they have one instead of an arcane.(Note: The class still requires an arcane class to be able to pick the class)


[b][center][size=4](Undead Companion)[/size][/center]

[/b]The Companion is Neutral Evil and you will have a selection of 4 types with attributes in accordance to the class they are best aligned with.(You can multiclass them if you wish.)
Undead Companions get 4 custom generic classes of Fighter, Cleric, Wizard, Rogue. All of them should function just like the player's except for Cleric.

Cleric - Is limited on domains thus will not get access to swift or impossible domains. They will also not receive access to good aligned domains and a couple I have not implemented yet. This is of course homebrew content.


[size=4][b][center](Feats)[/center][/b][/size]
[b]Adept Channel[/b] - Give a weak channel energy ability to those that take adept class
[b]Strike True[/b] - Use a move action to gain a small bonus to attack.
[b]Channel Smite[/b] - Apply channel energy to the first attack. If it misses the charge is wasted.
[b]Greater Channel Smite[/b] - Channel Energy is applied to the first "hit" on the target.
[b]Guided Hand[/b] - Use wisdom instead of strength or dexterity for attack bonus with your deity's favored weapon.
[b]Hex Strike[/b] - On a successful "unarmed" attack on an enemy your next hex targetting an enemy is a swift action.
[b]Monastic Legacy[/b] - You gain half progression towards your unarmed attacks as if you had taken monk levels. Does not count towards monk abilities/feats.
[b]Blooded Arcane Strike[/b] - While bloodraging gain the benefits of arcane strike.
[b]Fire Music[/b] - Allows the user to convert their spells to fire damage.
[b]Discordant Voice[/b] - When using Bard Music add sonic damage to all effected allies.


[b][center][size=4](Basic Action)[/size][/center][/b]
[b]Aid Another[/b] - Use a standard action on an ally to give them AB or AC

Abhoth

Bokrug

[/b]
[b][center][size=4](Domains)[/size][/center][/b]
[b]Void Domain(Modded)[/b] - A domain built for travel and summoning

[b][center][size=4](Mythic Feats)[/size][/center][/b]
[b]Mythic Guided Hand[/b] - Use wisdom instead of strength for your damage with your deity's favored weapon.
[b]Mythic Crossbow Training(Homebrew)[/b] - Gain dex to damage when using crossbows

[b][center][size=4](Mythic Abilities)[/size][/center][/b]
[b]Abundant Fabrication(Homebrew)[/b] - Provides up to 10 extra fabrications per day.
[b]Whirlwind Attack(Homebrew)[/b] - Provides the caster 6 extra attacks for 1 round at a -4 damage and attack penalty.
[b]Greater Whirldwind Attack(Homebrew)[/b] - Same as whirlwind attack without the penalty.
[b]Hardiness[/b](Homebrew) - Provides the caster 40% resistance to damage for 1 round per 2 class levels.
[b]Critical Strikes(Homebrew)[/b] - Once per day cause all your attacks for the next round to be critical hits.
[b]Stunning Strikes(Homebrew)[/b] - Causes your melee attacks to cause the opponent to be stunned.
[b]Warcry(Homebrew)[/b] - All effected have their damage lowered and take increased damage.
[b]Relentless Strikes(homebrew)[/b] - Each successful sneak attack adds additional sneak damage for 1 round.




[color=#f4f4f4][size=5][b][center]Homebrew Content(Optional "AC" Mod)[/center][/b][/size][/color]
[b][center][size=4](Mythic Ability)[/size][/center][/b]
[b]Abundant Casting(Homebrew)[/b] - This custom ability lets a spellcaster regain a number of spells per day of any spell level based on their mythic level.(2+1 per mythic level up to a maximum of 12 uses per day.) Picking this mythic ability disallows use of the original version and vice versa.

[b]Empowered Bombs[/b] - Will increase alchemist bomb damage by 50%

[b]Maximized Bombs[/b] - (Requires Empowered Bombs) - Will make all dice rolls maximized for alchemist bombs.

[size=4][b][center](Weapon)[/center][/b][/size]
[b]Numerian Greatsword[/b] - Abilities now last for 1 minute instead of 1 round, added Force Shield Ability, Attribute increases are now Alchemical instead of enhancement.

[b]Blaster Bracer[/b] - Is a light crossbow and is now usable by players.(is a +0 lightcrossbow, but deals 1d8 force damage).

[b]Fang of Malice [/b]- No longer has a permanent buff after raging. While raging the character will act as if under the legendary proportions spell and every successful hit will rend the enemies armor permanently by 1 stacking up to 5 times.

[size=4][b][center](Companions)[/center][/b][/size]
Now start at Level 1!!!!!!! (Do note a certain late game brother will lose his character as he will be a level 1 paladin with no way to become a hellknight.)

[b][center][size=4](Archetype Changes)[/size][/center]

Judge[/b] - Judgement Aura is now a standard action(Was swift), Sentence is now a
move action(Was swift). This should make Judge a slightly better party
buffer.

[b]Forester[/b] - Forester now gets favored terrain rank ups meaning you are no longer stuck at +2 favored terrain bonuses.
